description: DEMOLITION OF EXISTING 5 X COVERED TENNIS COURTS AND ERECTION OF A NEW BUILDING COMPRISING OF 6 X INDOOR COURTS AND ASSOCIATED FACILITIES, 6 X OUTDOOR TENNIS COURTS,  SINGLE STOREY BASEMENT FOR PARKING (UP TO 338 VEHICLE SPACES AND 60 CYCLE SPACES), 9 EXTERNAL COVERED CAR PARKING SPACES, RELOCATION OF CHILLER PLANT (WHICH SERVICES CENTRE COURT ROOF) AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT, ASSOCIATED LANDSCAPING, HARDSTANDING, ACCESS ROADS, BOUNDARY ENCLOSURES AND AMENDED ACCESS ARRANGEMENTS.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [2500 Rev A, 2501 Rev A, 2510 Rev B, 2511 Rev B, 2512 Rev B, 2513 Rev B, 2520 Rev A, 2521 Rev A, 2522 Rev A, 2523 Rev A, 2530 Rev A, 2531 Rev A, 2532 Rev A, 2533 Rev A, SRC414-GRA-X-100-DR-L- 1300 Rev 03, 1301 Rev 03, 1302 Rev 03, 1303 Rev 02, 1304 Rev 02, 1305 Rev 03, 1306 Rev 03, 1307 Rev 03 and 1308 Rev 03.]

Condition : 3 - No development, other than demolition and below ground works shall take place until details of particulars and samples of the materials to be used on all external faces of the development hereby permitted, including window frames and doors (notwithstanding any materials specified in the application form and/or the approved drawings), have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. No works which are the subject of this condition shall be carried out until the details are approved, and the development shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 4 - No development, other than demolition and below ground works shall take place until details of the surfacing of all those parts of the site not covered by buildings or soft landscaping, including any parking, service areas or roads, footpaths, hard and soft have been submitted in writing for approval by the Local Planning Authority. No works that are the subject of this condition shall be carried out until the details are approved, and the development shall not be occupied / the use of the development hereby approved shall not commence until the details have been approved and works to which this condition relates have been carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 5 - No development, other than demolition and below ground works shall take place until details of all boundary walls or fences are submitted in writing for approval to the Local Planning Authority. No works which are the subject of this condition shall be carried out until the details are approved, and the development shall not be occupied / the use of the development hereby approved shall not commence until the details are approved and works to which this condition relates have been carried out in accordance with the approved details. The walls and fencing shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Condition : 6 - The indoor tennis facility hereby permitted shall operate only between the hours of 07.00 to 23.00 on any day outside the annual Wimbledon Tennis Championship period and between 06.30 and 00.00 during the annual Wimbledon Tennis Championship

Condition : 7 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 8 - The premises shall only be used for tennis and activities associated with the operation of The Championships, and for no other purpose, (including any other purpose within Class D2 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes Order) 1987), or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification.

Condition : 9 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the cycle parking shown on the plans hereby approved has been provided and made available for use. These facilities shall be retained for the occupants of and visitors to the development at all times.

Condition : 11 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until a detailed Car Park Management Plan, which sets out the parking demand and management for all users of the basement and grade level parking inside and outside the Championships and a strategy to reduce parking over time has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The Car Park Management Plan shall include plans showing the agreed parking and non-parking areas in the lead up/dismantling and inside championship and outside championship periods. The development shall not be occupied until the details of the plan have been approved and the development shall thereafter operate in strict accordance with such measures as are approved unless the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority is obtained to any variation.

Condition : 12 - Prior to the commencement of the development hereby permitted, a Construction Logistics Plan (including a plan confirming vehicle routing) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved measures shall be implemented prior to commencement and shall be so maintained for the duration of the use, unless the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority is first obtained to any variation.

Condition : 13 - The details and measures for the protection of the existing trees as specified in the approved document 'Arboricultural Survey, Impact Assessment & Method Statement' reference '35.52E' dated February 2017 including sheets 1, 2 & 3 of the drawing titled: `Tree Protection Plan' numbered `35.52.02D Rev.D' shall be fully complied with. The methods for the protection of the existing trees shall follow the sequence of construction and tree protection as set out in the document. The details and measures as approved shall be retained and maintained until the completion of site works. 

Reason: To protect and safeguard the existing trees in accordance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policy CS13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and 02 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014;

Condition : 14 - The details of the Arboricultural Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan shall include the retention of an arboricultural expert to supervise, monitor and report to the LPA not less than monthly the status of all tree works and tree protection measures throughout the course of the construction period. At the conclusion of the construction period the arboricultural expert shall submit to the LPA a satisfactory completion statement to demonstrate compliance with the approved protection measures.

Condition : 15 - No work shall be commenced until details of the proposed design, materials, and method of excavation and construction of the basement and foundations to be used within 12 metres of the two existing retained Corsican Pine trees (T29 & T30) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such details shall have regard to the BS 5837:2012 and shall include an addendum to the Arboricultural Method Statement, Site supervision and the Tree Protection Plan. The work shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details. 

Reason:  To protect and safeguard the existing retained trees in accordance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policy CS13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy O2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 16 - The trees shown on the approved drawing number `SRC414-GRAX-100-DR-L-5100 Rev.04� shall be planted in accordance with the approved details. The works shall be carried out in the first available planting season following the completion of the development or prior to the occupation of any part of the development, whichever is the sooner, and shall thereafter be maintained in accordance with the approved Landscape Management Plan.

Reason:  To enhance the appearance of the development in the interest of the amenities of the area, to ensure the provision sustainable drainage surfaces and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies 5.1, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policies CS13 and CS16 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2, F2 and O2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 17 - Prior to the occupation of the development a Landscape Management Plan including the long term design objectives, management responsibilities and maintenance schedules for all landscaped areas shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The landscape management plan shall be carried out in accordance with the approved scheme unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason:  To enhance the appearance of the development in the interest of the amenities of the area, to ensure the provision sustainable drainage surfaces and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies 5.1, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policies CS13 and CS16 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2, F2 and O2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 18 - No development shall take place until full details of the landscaping and planting scheme shown on the approved drawing number `SRC414-GRA-X-100-DR-L-5100 Rev.04�has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and the soft landscaping work shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details. The details shall include on a plan, full details of the size, species, spacing, quantities and location of proposed plants. The works shall be carried out in the first available planting season following the completion of the development or prior to the occupation of any part of the development, whichever is the sooner. The planting shall be maintained in accordance with the approved Landscape Management Plan.

Reason:  To enhance the appearance of the development in the interest of the amenities of the area, to ensure the provision sustainable drainage surfaces and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies 5.1, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policies CS13 and CS16 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2, F2 and O2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 19 - The holm oak tree identified as T65 shall only be felled between the months of February and November. The limbs and cavities of the tree must be lowered to the ground when the tree is dismantled and left for a minimum of 24 hours before being logged or removed from the site as these trees have moderate to high bat roosting potential. 

Reason: In order to conserve and enhance biodiversity and wildlife habitats in accordance with the provisions of policy CS.13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 20 - Any vegetation clearance must be undertaken outside of the breeding season (March-August inclusive). Should any vegetation clearance be undertaken during the breeding season the applicant must appoint a suitably qualified ecologist to undertake a nest survey and submit a report to the Local Planning Authority for approval. This report shall list the nests and proposed mitigation measures to ensure the proposed works do not adversely affect bird nesting on site prior to the commencement of vegetation clearance. This is in accordance with the recommendations in section 5.1 of the submitted Habitat Report and is required to ensure there are no adverse effects on bird nesting on site during the breeding season. 

Reason: In order to conserve and enhance biodiversity and wildlife habitats in accordance with the provisions of policy CS.13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 21 - Any foundations, holes or deep pits present on site during construction which are left overnight require a secured plank or other means of escape for mammals to be made available. This is to ensure that mammals recorded in the area that could potentially venture on site can safely migrate from the site during construction being undertaken. 

Reason: In order to conserve and enhance biodiversity and wildlife habitats in accordance with the provisions of policy CS.13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 22 - In line with the recommendation set out in the Arboriculture report, Heras fencing shall be erected to protect the extent of the root system of retained trees and along the tree line identified as TN20 in compliance with Standard BS5837 (Trees in relation to design, demolition and construction). This is to ensure that this existing vegetation is not adversely affected by construction activities. 

Reason: In order to conserve and enhance biodiversity and wildlife habitats in accordance with the provisions of policy CS.13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 23 - Should any non-native invasive species identified in Section 4.4.10 of the submitted Habitat Report and those listed in Schedule 9 of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981require removal from the site these are to be removed by a suitably qualified and licensed contractor to ensure compliance with the act and prevent the spread of invasive species.  

Reason: In order to conserve and enhance biodiversity and wildlife habitats in accordance with the provisions of policy CS.13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 24 - The planting of existing hedge/tree lined areas along the northern and western boundaries shall be planted with native fruit and berry species in accordance with the submitted Landscape Strategy Report to help enhance the wildlife value of the site and in compliance with enhancement recommendations in section 5.2 (1) of the submitted Habitat Survey Report. 

Reason: In order to conserve and enhance biodiversity and wildlife habitats in accordance with the provisions of policy CS.13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 25 - No development, other than demolition and below ground works shall take place until details of 10 bird nesting boxes in mature trees out of direct sunlight, not restricted by vegetation above 3m from ground level and away from any structure that would allow domestic cats to reach them, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Two of the boxes must be smaller, open front boxes and made to British Trust for Ornithology dimensions, two boxes must be hole type boxes with 25mm and 28mm holes in accordance with the British Trust for Ornithology dimensions and six hole box type boxes with 32mm hole dimensions located in groups of 3 are to be installed. These boxes are to be located on site in the locations identified on the proposed location map in section 3.1, page 21 of the submitted Landscape Strategy Report. 

This is to ensure that  birds have nesting opportunities in order to enhance the wildlife value of the site. The approved details shall be permanently retained as such and fully implemented before the first occupation of the building.

Reason: In order to conserve and enhance biodiversity and wildlife habitats in accordance with the provisions of policy CS.13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 26 - No development, other than demolition and below ground works shall take place until details of 6 bat boxes to be installed in mature trees located on site in the locations identified on the proposed location map in section 3.1, page 21 of the submitted Landscape Strategy Report. Boxes should be located at least 5m above ground level with clear flight lines have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Bat boxes that are suitable for Pipistrelle or nocturnal bats must be used. This is to ensure that any bats commuting through the site have additionally opportunities to nest in the area and in turn enhance the wildlife value of the site. The approved details shall be permanently retained as such and fully implemented before the first occupation of the building.

Reason: In order to conserve and enhance biodiversity and wildlife habitats in accordance with the provisions of policy CS.13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 27 - No development, other than demolition and below ground works shall take place until details of  stag beetle logger in the location identified on the proposed location map in section 3.1, page 21 of the submitted Landscape Strategy Report in accordance with the specifications specified in section 5.2 Enhancement Recommendations (4) of the submitted Habitat Survey Report have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This is to ensure that the site can support any stag beetles migrating to the site from the surrounding area in order to help enhance the wildlife value of the site. The approved details shall be permanently retained as such and fully implemented before the first occupation of the building.

Reason: In order to conserve and enhance biodiversity and wildlife habitats in accordance with the provisions of policy CS.13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 29 - Any external lighting, which shall not include external floodlighting, shall be installed in accordance with the submitted External Lighting Proposals Report issued February 2017 (document number 14030-LD-RP001) by ME Engineers unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. The external lighting shall be positioned and angled to prevent any light spillage or glare beyond the site boundary.

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies DM D2 and DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Polices Plan 2014.

Condition : 30 - No external public address system shall be operated at the site other than during the annual Wimbledon Tennis Championship period.

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2015 and policy DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Polices Plan 2014.

Condition : 31 - Prior to the commencement of the development, a noise assessment shall be undertaken during The Championships and submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This noise assessment shall be used to demonstrate that there is no noise increase associated with the chiller plant (which serves Centre Court roof) above the recorded background noise level at the nearest property building line to the relocated chiller plant. The chiller plant shall only operate during The Championships with the exception of testing and maintenance.
Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2015 and policy DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Polices Plan 2014.

Condition : 32 - Details of the acoustic barrier adjacent to the most southerly courts (labelled as Courts 5 and 6 on Drawing No. 2512 Rev B) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the occupation of the development. The acoustic barrier should ensure that noise from the proposed use will not exceed 5 dB(A) above the existing typical measured background noise level over a measurement period not exceeding 15 minutes (LAF90, 15 minutes) at locations representative of the nearest noise sensitive dwellings

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2015 and policy DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Polices Plan 2014.

Condition : 33 - Details of the External Clay Court Management Strategy, which shall be in accordance with the principles outlined in the Noise Impact Assessment - Part 2 dated January 2017, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted. 

The External Clay Court Management Strategy shall:

"	restrict the usage of the two most northerly courts (labelled as Courts 1 and 2 on Drawing No. 2512 Rev B) to no earlier than 09:00 and no later than 18:00 on any day, with the exception of 12 instances per year where Courts 1 and 2 shall be used no later than 20:00, unless it can be shown to the Council's satisfaction by way of ongoing noise assessments that the residential amenities of neighbouring properties shall not be adversely affected.

"	restrict the two usage of the two most northerly courts (labelled as Courts 1 and 2 on Drawing No. 2512 Rev B) on weekends and bank holidays to no more than 40 'instances' per year, unless it can be shown to the Council's satisfaction by way of ongoing noise assessments that the residential amenities of neighbouring properties shall not be adversely affected;

"	outline measures to encourage players to use Courts 3, 4, 5 and 6 (labelled as such on Drawing No. 2512 Rev B) instead of Courts 1 and 2 (labelled as such on Drawing No. 2512 Rev B).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2015 and policy DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Polices Plan 2014.

Condition : 34 - Prior to occupation of the development hereby permitted details of Electric Vehicle Charging Points (minimum of 20% active, plus 10% passive) for the staff parking and parking for Blue Badge holders in line with the London Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and implemented prior to the first use of the development and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of an appropriate level of car parking and minimise the effect of the development on local air quality in line with policy CS20 of the Merton Core Planning Strategy and policies 6.13 and 7.14 of the London Plan.

Condition : 36 - No development, other than demolition and below ground works shall take place until a detailed access strategy for the development including details of how the design of the proposed tennis courts, car parking, changing facilities, hospitality areas and public realm would be accessible to staff and visitors with disabilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details thereby approved prior to the first use of the particular space.

Reason - To ensure the facilities promote inclusive design in line with planning policy 7.2 of the London Plan (March 2015) and DM D2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan (July 2014)

Condition : 37 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, no part of the development hereby approved shall be used or occupied until a Post-Construction Review Certificate issued by the Building Research Establishment or other equivalent assessors confirming that the non-residential development has achieved a BREEAM rating of not less than the standards equivalent to 'Very Good', and evidence demonstrating that the development has achieved not less than a 26.83% improvement in CO2 emissions reduction compared to Part L 2013 regulations as outlined in the approved Energy Statement (November 2016), has been submitted to and acknowledged in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason - To ensure that the development achieves a high standard of sustainability and makes efficient use of resources and to comply the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 5.2 of the London Plan 2011 and policy CS15 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 38 - No development, other than demolition and below ground works shall take place until  details to demonstrate that the development could be future-proofed for connection to a future district heating network shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details thereby approved and the development future-proofed for connection. In the event that such a district heating scheme becomes available the development shall connect to it, unless it can be demonstrated to the Local Planning Authority (to whom details shall be provided) that connection would not be feasible.

Reason - To demonstrate that the site heat network has been designed to link all building uses on site (domestic and non-domestic) and to demonstrate that sufficient space has been allocated in the plant room for future connection to wider district heating in accordance with London Plan policies 5.5 and 5.6.

Condition : 39 - No development, other than demolition and below ground works shall take place until details of the proposed Combined Heat and Power (CHP) have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

Reason - To ensure that the development achieves a high standard of sustainability and makes efficient use of resources and to comply the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 5.2 of the London Plan 2011 and policy CS15 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Condition : 40 - Noise levels, (expressed as the equivalent continuous sound level) LAeq (10 minutes), from the covered courts building shall not exceed LA90-10dB at the boundary with the closest residential property.

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of surrounding area and to ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2015, policy CS7 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 41 - The centre court plant hereby approved shall only be operated during the Wimbledon Tennis Championship period or such other dates as may be previously agreed with the Local Planning Authority, other than for testing immediately prior to the championships, and shall not be operated prior to 0800 hours or later than 2300 hours or one hour after the finish of the last match on any day, whichever is the earlier.

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of surrounding area and to ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2015, policy CS7 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 42 - No development shall take place until details of a Demolition Method Statement agreed by the appointed Contractor undertaking the demolition works has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority . A survey has to be undertaken to identify any hazardous materials such as materials containing asbestos, lead etc. The method statement should incorporate any recommendations from the survey report and include the subsequent management, handling and safe disposal of such materials. The development shall be carried out in full compliance with the approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   

Reason-  To ensure the safe demolition and disposal of materials in line with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy DM D2 & DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Polices Plan 2014.

Condition : 43 - No development shall take place until details of a Construction Method Statement agreed by the appointed Contractor's undertaking the piling, excavation and basement construction works has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Construction Method Statement shall details relating to piling sequencing and structural drawings, temporary work drawings (different propping and de-propping stages) and working and structural drawings of the basement retaining wall. The development shall be carried out in full compliance with the approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2015 and policy DM EP2 & DM D2 of Merton's Sites and Polices Plan 2014.

Condition : 44 - No development shall take place until details of the Design calculations of the secant piles closest to the existing contiguous piles & combination of existing contiguous piles and lateral spanning concrete walls has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in full compliance with the approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason - To ensure adequate control over the construction of the basement and to safeguard neighbouring properties in line with planning policy DM D2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan (July 2014)

Condition : 45 - No development shall take place until details of the Movement Monitoring report produced by the specialist surveyors appointed to install the monitoring gauges to detect any movement of the highway/neighbouring properties during the works has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The detailed report should include the locations of the horizontal and vertical movement monitoring, frequency of monitoring, trigger levels (green, amber and red) for the various respective locations, the actions required for different trigger alarms etc. The development shall be carried out in full compliance with the approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason - To ensure adequate control over the construction of the basement and to safeguard neighbouring properties in line with planning policy DM D2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan (July 2014)

Condition : 46 - No development, other than demolition and below ground works shall take place until details of the proposed green roofs above the proposed HV/LV switch room (including: species, planting density, substrate, a section drawing at scale 1:20 demonstrating the adequate depth availability for a viable green roof; and a maintenance plan) are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The measures shall be carried out in the first available planting season following the completion of the development or prior to the occupation of any part of the development, whichever is the sooner and be permanently retained as such.

Reason: In order to conserve and enhance biodiversity and wildlife habitats in accordance with the provisions of policy CS.13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.
Condition : 47 - The gates hereby approved shall not open over the adjacent highway.

Condition : 48 - No Development, other than demolition and below ground works, shall not commence until a Delivery and Servicing Plan (the Plan) has been submitted in writing for approval to the Local Planning Authority. No occupation of the development shall be permitted until the Plan is approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and implemented in accordance with the approved plan.  The approved measures shall be maintained, in accordance with the Plan, for the duration of the use, unless the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority is obtained to any variation.

Condition : 49 - Other than the permitted lighting (External Lighting Proposals Report issued February 2017), no external lighting shall be installed without the prior approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 50 - Planning Informative - 

'Instances' refers to play on Courts 1 and 2 on a Saturday, Sunday and Bank Holiday. For the avoidance of doubt play on Courts 1 and 2 on a Saturday, Sunday and Bank Holiday within one weekend constitutes one 'instance'.

'The Championships' refers to the two week period each year when The Championships, Wimbledon tennis tournament is in operation at the All England Lawn Tennis Club, Church Road, Wimbledon, SW19 5AE. It shall also include the one week period prior to The Championships.

Condition : 51 - Planning Informative - No surface water runoff should discharge onto the public highway including the public footway or highway. When it is proposed to 	connect to a public sewer, the site drainage should be separate and combined at the final manhole nearest the boundary.   Where the developer proposes to discharge to a public sewer, prior approval from Thames Water Developer Services will be required (contact no. 0845 850 2777).

Condition : 52 - Planning Informative - You are advised to contact the Council's Highways team on 020 8545 3700 before undertaking any works within the Public Highway to obtain the necessary approvals and/or licences. Please be advised that there is a further charge for this work. If your application falls within a Controlled Parking Zone this has further costs involved and can delay the application by 6 to 12 months.

Condition : 53 - Planning Informative - Any works/events carried out either by, or at the behest of, the developer, whether they are located on, or affecting a prospectively maintainable highway, as defined under Section 87 of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991, or on or affecting the public highway, shall be co-ordinated under the requirements of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991 and the Traffic management Act 2004 and licensed accordingly in order to secure the expeditious movement of traffic by minimising disruption to users of the highway network in Merton. Any such works or events commissioned by the developer and particularly those involving the connection of any utility to the site, shall be co-ordinated by them in liaison with the London Borough of Merton, Network Coordinator, (telephone 020 8545 3976). This must take place at least one month in advance of the works and particularly to ensure that statutory undertaker connections/supplies to the site are co-ordinated to take place wherever possible at the same time.
site_number: The All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club, Indoor Tennis Courts
